body_html: @zakizhou Well I believe that you can do whatever dirty work under the hood but it would be nice if the users of the API are not forced to use setattr to finish the high level job. But this debate is very subjective and totally beyond the point of this thread, which is about the functional API. Anyway thank you very much for that suggestion :)
body_text: @zakizhou Well I believe that you can do whatever dirty work under the hood but it would be nice if the users of the API are not forced to use setattr  to finish the high level job. But this debate is very subjective and totally beyond the point of this thread, which is about the functional API. Anyway thank you very much for that suggestion :)
body: @zakizhou Well I believe that you can do whatever dirty work under the hood but it would be nice if the users of the API are not forced to use `setattr ` to finish the high level job. But this debate is very subjective and totally beyond the point of this thread, which is about the functional API. Anyway thank you very much for that suggestion :)
